hero.heading: Habitat Assessment
hero.text: Exploring and protecting the wetlands, rivers, and forests that safeguard the critically endangered Philippine crocodile.

sections.heading: Wetlands & Rivers
sections.text: The Philippine crocodile thrives in freshwater wetlands and rivers in Northern Luzon. These ecosystems provide food, nesting sites, and shelter, but are under threat from overfishing and pollution.

sections.heading: Forests & Floodplains
sections.text: Healthy forests regulate water quality and provide crucial cover for crocodiles and other wildlife. Deforestation and habitat conversion continue to pose risks to biodiversity.

sections.heading: Community Partnerships
sections.text: Local communities are at the heart of conservation. Habitat assessments guide protection programs while empowering residents to sustainably manage their environment.

cta.heading: Help Protect Their Habitat
cta.text: Your support ensures the survival of the Philippine crocodile and the health of our rivers and forests. Join us in conservation.
